FuncDef:
The ipv6 nd direct-route preference command sets a priority of IPv6 NDP Vlink direct routes.
The undo ipv6 nd direct-route preference command restores the default priority. The ipv6 nd direct-route preference command sets a priority of IPv6 NDP Vlink direct routes. The undo ipv6 nd direct-route preference command restores the default priority. By default, no priority is set for IPv6 NDP Vlink direct routes. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K, CE6820S, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.
ParentView: 100ge sub-interface view,10GE sub-interface view,200GE sub-interface view,25GE sub-interface view,400GE sub-interface view,50GE sub-interface view,Eth-Trunk sub-interface view,VBDIF interface view,VLANIF interface view

ParaDef.Info:
Set the priority of IPv6 NDP Vlink direct routes.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 255. A smaller value indicates a higher priority.

ExtraInfo: IPv6 NDP Vlink direct routes can be advertised using various routing protocols. To set priority values for such routes advertised by different routing protocols in route selection, run the ipv6 nd direct-route preference command.
